#Conversion fetched from http://www.unicode.org/Public/UNIDATA/EmojiSources.txt
#The emoji->softbank table can be found on the official softbank site:
#http://creation.mb.softbank.jp/mc/tech/tech_pic/pic_material_1.html
#softbank->sjis (needed for unicode.org's table) can be found here:
#http://cpansearch.perl.org/src/MIYAGAWA/Encode-JP-Mobile-0.18/ucm/x-utf8-softbank.ucm
#The following emoji have special notes
#E02D received an update. The old character matches 1F559 'CLOCK FACE TEN OCLOCK' as is in the table.
#The new character matches both 1F559 and 23f0 'ALARM CLOCK', but better fits 23f0.
#E02D 1F559 #Old Emoji = 10 oclock
#E02D 23F0 #New emoji = Alarm Clock
#E211 was missing in the original source. It was added as U+27BF 'DOUBLE CURLY LOOP' as expected.
#E50A is not an official unicode character, however it has been
#implemented in Twitter and IOS 5.0 emoji sets as E50A 'SHIBUYA'. This mapping was added to the table.
